Hi Glen,

Great news, the password reset is now working as expected. We’ve tested this on our end as well

You can log in using the custom admin link here:
👉 https://nswselfinsurers.com.au/nsw-login

A couple of quick notes for your reference:
  • Password reset
    • You should now be able to reset your password without any issues.
  • Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)
    • All users with backend access have a 10-day grace period to complete their 2FA setup.
    • This is an added security measure to help keep the website protected.

How to set up 2FA (via Wordfence)
  1. Log in to the dashboard
  2. Scroll down to Wordfence

  3. Click Login Security

  1. Scan the QR code, enter the generated code, and click Activate


If you need a hand with the setup, just let me know, always happy to help 😊
will do this at night the propagation is taking time

Hi Glen,

Thank you for confirming 😊

We’ll go ahead and update the site administration email to support@wolfiq.com.au.

Just a quick heads-up, our SMTP configuration is still in progress. Once this has fully propagated and email delivery is confirmed, we’ll let you know right away so you can continue with the remaining security steps without any issues.

Thanks again for your patience, we’re almost there 🙏

As always, please feel free to reach out if anything else comes up.

Hi Glen,

Thanks for sending those through, that’s really helpful.

It looks like the issue you’re seeing is related to the site administration email, which WordPress uses for security and reset notifications.

To resolve this smoothly, could you please confirm one of the following for us:
  • Would you be happy for us to update the administration email to support@wolfiq.com.au
  • Would you prefer us to set it to another email address of your choice?

Once confirmed, I’ll update it straight away and make sure the reset process works as expected.
Thanks again for your patience, we’re nearly there 🙏

Always happy to help.

Hi Glen,

Looking into this now and will get back to you as shortly

Hi Glen,

Thank you so much for confirming, really appreciate your patience while we locked everything down.

Here’s a quick summary of what we’ve completed and the next steps:
  1. Password resets
    • We’ve reset all existing passwords as an immediate security measure.
    • We strongly recommend that all admins and users with backend access reset their own passwords as well and ensure they’re set to something strong and unique.
  2. Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)
    • 2FA has now been enabled for the site.
    • There is a 10-day grace period for all admins and backend users to complete their setup.
    • Users can set up 2FA by visiting this page once logged in:
      https://nswselfinsurers.com.au/wp-admin/admin.php?page=WFLS
  3. Custom admin login URL
    • We’ve set up a custom login link for added protection.
    • Please use this URL going forward to log in:
      https://nswselfinsurers.com.au/nsw-login/
We’re continuing to actively monitor the website to ensure everything remains secure and stable.

If you or the team run into any issues during setup, or if you’d like us to review user access in more detail, just let us know, always happy to help 🙏

Hi Allie,

All of that sounds great and I think is a good idea

Regards

Glen Coleman | Workers Compensation Manager

Fletcher International Exports Pty Ltd (Self-Insurer 290)

Lot 11 Yarrandale Road, Dubbo NSW 2830

M +61 0461 329 089

glenc@fletchint.com.au | workerscomp@fletchint.com.au | http://www.fletchint.com.au/

Hi Glen,

Also, to add an extra layer of security, we can provide a custom login link for admins instead of using the usual /wp-admin .

This can help reduce the risk of unauthorized login attempts. Would it be okay for us to set that up?

Hi Glen,

I’ve looked into the issue more closely, and it appears the website had a compromise from before the recent migration. We’ve cleaned it up and are continuously monitoring the site, including updating the index.php , so it should now be secure.

To further protect the website, I wanted to consult with you before taking the next steps:
  1. Password Resets: We can send reset passwords to all admins and editors to secure access.
  2. User Access Review: Could you check which users we might limit or remove access for?
  3. Two-Factor Authentication (2FA): We recommend installing a security plugin such as Wordfence to enable 2FA moving forward.
Please let me know if you’re okay for us to proceed with these measures.

Rest assured, we are constantly monitoring the website 🙏

Always happy to help,

Please feel free to reach out if you need anything in the meantime.
